title: Mill on the Floss metaphor sunshine

content.question: At the end of the second sentence of the first paragraph (“make the sunshine . . . day-star”), the narrator makes a comparison between human faces and the Sun in order to

choices.label: imply that during good financial times it is easy to escape winter and enjoy time with friends and family
suggest that even the poor and downtrodden feel better with friends and family nearby
show that holiday cheer can provide friends and family a warm escape on even the coldest of dark winter days
demonstrate the warmth a group of friends and family can provide when gathered together indoors

content.answer: imply that during good financial times it is easy to escape winter and enjoy time with friends and family

skill.text: Skill 6.B: Identify and explain the function of a metaphor.
